name: NAVFAC
description: NAVFAC provides the Navy and Marine Corps with facilities engineering, planning, design, construction, real estate, environmental, and public works support worldwide.

painPoints.point: SIOP execution responsibility - delivering complex $21B+ shipyard infrastructure modernization with severe cost overruns
painPoints.source: NAVFAC PMO-555 SIOP & GAO-22-105993 Naval Shipyards Report

painPoints.point: Portsmouth Naval Shipyard dry dock concrete repairs - $8.6M SIOP contract awarded FY2025 as part of broader SIOP challenges
painPoints.source: DVIDS NAVFAC Mid-Atlantic SIOP Contract Award 2025

painPoints.point: Climate resilience infrastructure adaptation - rising sea levels and extreme weather threatening naval installations
painPoints.source: NAVFAC Climate Change Planning Handbook & GAO-20-511 Climate Resilience Report

painPoints.point: Energy resilience and microgrid deployment requirements per Executive Order 14057 and Climate Action 2030
painPoints.source: GAO-23-105239 Environmental Sustainability & NAVFAC SIOP Microgrid Study

painPoints.point: Small business MACC contract renewals - NAVFAC Southeast has 2 contracts expiring FY25 with no renewal decision
painPoints.source: NAVFAC Southeast Industry Brief 2025 SAME Charleston

painPoints.point: Energy Conservation Investment Program (ECIP) reporting and measurement gaps
painPoints.source: GAO-16-162 Defense Infrastructure Energy Conservation Report

painPoints.point: Climate risk integration into acquisition and supply chain processes
painPoints.source: GAO-20-511 Climate Resilience Contractor Risk Assessment

painPoints.point: Facility sustainment backlog across Naval installations worldwide

strategicPriorities.priority: SIOP program execution - dry dock recapitalization, infrastructure reconfiguration, industrial equipment modernization
strategicPriorities.source: NAVFAC PMO-555 SIOP & NAVFAC Northwest Program Overview 2025

strategicPriorities.priority: Small Business MACC programs - $700M active contracts across regions, 13 Facility Support Contracts ($107M), 12 Environmental Contracts ($108M)
strategicPriorities.source: NAVFAC Southeast Industry Brief 2025 & Regional MACC Programs

strategicPriorities.priority: Climate Action 2030 implementation - infrastructure resilience to extreme weather and sea-level rise
strategicPriorities.source: Department of Navy Climate Action 2030 Strategy

strategicPriorities.priority: Energy resilience and renewable energy - microgrids, solar, wind, advanced biofuels per Executive Order 14057
strategicPriorities.source: GAO-23-105239 Environmental Sustainability & Navy Climate Action 2030

strategicPriorities.priority: 8(a) small business construction programs - dedicated MACCs for SBA-certified firms across all regions
strategicPriorities.source: NAVFAC Marianas $75M MACC Award & NAVFAC Washington $249M 8(a) MACC

strategicPriorities.priority: Naval Academy climate resilience pier reconstruction and waterfront infrastructure
strategicPriorities.source: NAVFAC Washington Naval Academy Climate Resilience Projects

strategicPriorities.priority: Environmental restoration and compliance across installations
strategicPriorities.funding: $108M in environmental contracts (10 for 8(a), 2 for SB)

primary: GAO-20-511 Climate Resilience Contractor Risk - https://www.gao.gov/products/gao-20-511
secondary: DVIDS NAVFAC Mid-Atlantic SIOP Contract - https://www.dvidshub.net/news/549142
GAO-16-162 Energy Conservation Investment Program - https://www.gao.gov/products/gao-16-162

setAsidePreferences.smallBusiness: Very strong preference - $700M+ in dedicated small business MACCs, 85% of contracts to small businesses
setAsidePreferences.8a: Extensive use - dedicated 8(a) MACC programs across all regions ($75M Marianas, $249M Washington, $108M environmental)
setAsidePreferences.SDVOSB: Strong preference - dedicated facility support contracts

typicalContractSizes.large: $50M - $249M (MACC programs, SIOP dry dock projects, waterfront infrastructure)

prefers: NAVFAC MACC contract holders (regional and specialty)
Energy-efficient design and renewable energy experience
Climate resilience and sea-level rise adaptation expertise
procurementCharacteristics.contractingTimeline: 3-12 months average for task orders, 6-18 months for MACC awards
procurementCharacteristics.competitionLevel: Competitive for unrestricted, moderate for set-asides due to dedicated small business programs
evaluationFactors: Past performance in military construction and NAVFAC projects
Small business participation and subcontracting plan

Climate Action 2030 driving major infrastructure resilience contracts for sea-level rise and extreme weather adaptation

NAVFAC Southeast has 13 Facility Support Contracts ($107M) and 12 Environmental Contracts ($108M) planned
Energy resilience contracts growing - microgrids, solar, renewable energy per Executive Order 14057

NAVFAC Washington has $249M 8(a) MACC with 2-year base + two 3-year options (8 years total)
Climate resilience pier reconstruction at Naval Academy represents new contract category
